thread.title: One person dies after passenger train derails
thread.title_full: One person dies after passenger train derails

title: One person dies after passenger train derails
text: comments One person has been killed and up to 20 others injured after a passenger train derailed and flipped on its side near Brussels. The person who died in Saturday's accident was most likely not on the train itself, but was caught on or near the rails, according to the major of Leuven. The accident occurred around 1.20pm as the train left Leuven station at slow speed in the direction of Brussels Airport. Photos of the accident show one passenger car lying on its side. Leuven mayor Louis Tobback said most of the injured were only slightly hurt All train traffic in and out of Leuven, 12 miles east of Brussels, has been interrupted by the derailing Authorities launched an investigation into the cause of the incident, which was not immediately known Photos of the accident showed one passenger car lying on its side. Mr Tobback said most of the injured were only slightly hurt. All train traffic in and out of Leuven, 12 miles east of Brussels, has been interrupted by the derailing. Authorities launched an investigation into the cause of the derailing, which was not immediately known. RELATED ARTICLES
